data.event: The last tenant at Fithian House, named after the late Bradford Woods Mayor Ted Fithian, will move in next month, said Dick Lynch, executive director of the Spina Bifida Association of Western Pennsylvania.

event.title: applications for the units in September

data.event: The association started accepting applications for the units in September and about 12 people are on a waiting list for an apartment, Mr. Lynch said.

event.title: Housing and Urban Development financing this summer

data.event: The association probably will apply for Housing and Urban Development financing this summer, he added.
The Fithian House took about three years from concept to completion, Mr. Lynch said.

event.title: the end of the month, surveyors will look

data.event: Before the end of the month, surveyors will look over land that the Woodlands wants to make into a 6-foot-wide accessible and graded trail leading from Fithian House to the main campus, Ms. Uriss-Spehar said.

event.title: the end of the day, the employees and residents will sit

data.event: At the end of the day, the employees and residents will sit down and eat the meal together, Ms. Uriss-Spehar said.
